speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: We believe in Christ. As members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, we worship Him and follow His teachings in the scriptures.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: Before the Fall, our Heavenly Father spoke directly to Adam and Eve. Thereafter, the Father introduced His Only Begotten Son, Jesus Christ, as our Savior and Redeemer and gave us the command to “hear Him.” 1 From this direction we conclude that the scriptural records of words spoken by “God” or the “Lord” are almost always the words of Jehovah, our risen Lord, Jesus Christ. 2

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: We are given the scriptures to direct our lives. As the prophet Nephi taught us, we should “feast upon the words of Christ; for behold, the words of Christ will tell you all things what ye should do.” 3 Most of the scriptures reporting Jesus’s mortal ministries are descriptions of what He did . My message today consists of a selection of the words of our Savior—what He said . These are words recorded in the New Testament (including the inspired additions of Joseph Smith) and in the Book of Mormon. Most of these selections are in the sequence in which our Savior spoke them.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.” 4

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Blessed are … they [which] do hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled with the Holy Ghost .” 5

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.” 6

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “But I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.” 7

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.” 8

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “If ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.” 9

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.” 10

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Wherefore, seek not the things of this world but seek ye first to build up the kingdom of God, and to establish his righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you.” 11

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.” 12

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.” 13

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.” 14

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.” 15

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross and follow me.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And now for a man to take up his cross, is to deny himself all ungodliness, and every worldly lust, and keep my commandments.” 16

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Therefore, forsake the world, and save your souls; for what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?” 17

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or whether I speak of myself.” 18

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.” 19

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.” 20

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die.” 21

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “[The great commandment in the law is this:] Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “This is the first and great commandment.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And the second is like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.” 22

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself to him.” 23

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.” 24

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.” 25

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.” 26

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost:

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world.” 27

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: After His ministry in the Holy Land, Jesus Christ appeared to the righteous on the American continent. These are some of the words He spoke there:

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Behold, I am Jesus Christ the Son of God. I created the heavens and the earth, and all things that in them are. I was with the Father from the beginning. I am in the Father, and the Father in me; and in me hath the Father glorified his name.” 28

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “I am the light and the life of the world. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And ye shall offer up unto me no more the shedding of blood; yea, your sacrifices and your burnt offerings shall be done away, for I will accept none of your sacrifices and your burnt offerings.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And ye shall offer for a sacrifice unto me a broken heart and a contrite spirit. And whoso cometh unto me with a broken heart and a contrite spirit, him will I baptize with fire and with the Holy Ghost. …

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Behold, I have come unto the world to bring redemption unto the world, to save the world from sin.” 29

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And again I say unto you, ye must repent, and be baptized in my name, and become as a little child, or ye can in nowise inherit the kingdom of God.” 30

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Therefore I would that ye should be perfect even as I, or your Father who is in heaven is perfect.” 31

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Verily, verily, I say unto you, ye must watch and pray always, lest ye be tempted by the devil, and ye be led away captive by him.” 32

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Therefore ye must always pray unto the Father in my name.” 33

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Therefore, whatsoever ye shall do, ye shall do it in my name; therefore ye shall call the church in my name.” 34

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Behold I have given unto you my gospel, and this is the gospel which I have given unto you—that I came into the world to do the will of my Father, because my Father sent me.

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “And my Father sent me that I might be lifted up upon the cross; and after that I had been lifted up upon the cross, that I might draw all men unto me … to be judged of their works, whether they be good or whether they be evil.” 35

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “Now this is the commandment: Repent, all ye ends of the earth, and come unto me and be baptized in my name, that ye may be sanctified by the reception of the Holy Ghost, that ye may stand spotless before me at the last day.” 36

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: We believe in Christ. I conclude with what He said about how we should know and follow His teachings:

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: “But the Comforter, which is the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.” 37

speaker: President Dallin H. Oaks
role: First Counselor in the First Presidency
title: The Teachings of Jesus Christ
paragraph_text: I affirm the truth of these teachings in the name of Jesus Christ, amen.
